newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Louisiana Land bid up.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Louisiana Land bid up.

text.p: Louisiana Land and Exploration Co was bid sharply high before markets opened Thursday on news it and Burlington Resources Inc would merge in a $3 billion deal.
Traders reported largely quiet markets. "Things are being dominated by by earnings, which are pretty good," one said.
Lousiana Land was bid at 65 from a Wednesday close of 57-8/16, a trader said. Burlington Resources was not trading.
Under terms of the deal, Louisiana Land would merge with a Burlington Resources unit in an exchange of stock.

Among other active shares, Octel Communications Corp was trading at 30-5/8 from a close of 26-12/16. Lucent Technologies Inc said Wednesday it was buying the company for $31 a share, or about $1.8 billion in a cash purchase.
Western Digital Corp was trading at 43, down from a Wednesday close of 43-11/16. The company reported fourth-quarter earnings per share $0.1 below analysts' estimates.
AT&T Corp was trading at 36-1/2, up slightly from a closing price of 36-5/16. AT&T President John Walter, heir apparent to the company's chairman, resigned Wednesday.
Shared Technologies Fairchild Inc was bid at 9-1/2 from a close of 8-14/16. The company is merging with Tel-Save Holdings Inc.
Microsoft Corp was trading at 150-/14 ahead of the release of fourth-quarte earnings Thursday.
